tit.cmt: Turtle を Tortoise に修正しました。

sen.e: "Tsuru Kame" is a program of Noh, traditional masked dance-drama.
"Tsuru Kame" is a program of Noh, traditional masked dance-drama.
"Tsuru Kame" is a program of Noh, traditional masked dance-drama.

sen.j: 天下泰平、国家の長久を祈念し、祝福するという、おめでたい内容である。
sen.e: It is a joyous program which prays and celebrates universal peace and everlasting state.
It is a joyous program which prays and celebrates universal peace and everlasting state.
It is a joyous program which prays and celebrates universal peace and everlasting state.

sen.j: 能の現行演目の中では最も短いもので、初心者向きの入門曲として知られている。
sen.e: It is the shortest program which is played today and is known as a program for a beginner.
It is the shortest program which is played today and is known as a program for a beginner.
It is the shortest program which is played today and is known as a program for a beginner.

[Category] The first group noh (Waki noh [noh at the side])
sen.cmt: waki noh に [noh at the side] を追記しました。
sen.e: [Category] The first group noh (Waki noh [noh at the side])

sen.j: 能ツレ(または子方)：鶴、亀
sen.e: Noh Tsure (or Kokata): crane, turtle
Noh Tsure (subordinate role attached to the shite) (or Kokata): crane, tortoise
sen.cmt: No Tsure に (subordinate role attached to the shite) を追記しました。turtle を tortoise に修正しました。

Noh waki (supporting role): minister
sen.cmt: 訳語集では「No waki」となっていましたが、他とそろえ「Noh」としました。

Noh waki (supporting role): minister

sen.j: 新春、唐の都の朝廷において、年の最初の四季の節会（せちえ、季節の変わり目の祝祭）が催された。
sen.e: On New Year's holiday at the imperial court of capital of Tang, the first Sechi-e (seasonal court banquet) of the year was held.
On New Year's day at the imperial court of capital of Tang, the first Sechi-e (seasonal court banquet) of the year was held.
sen.cmt: holiday を day に修正しました。
sen.e: On New Year's day at the imperial court of capital of Tang, the first Sechi-e (seasonal court banquet) of the year was held.

sen.j: 絢爛豪華な宮殿で皇帝は百官卿相（ひゃっかんけいしょう・役人と貴族）の拝賀を受け、万民もその場に集う。
sen.e: In the palace of magnificent splendor, the emperor receives celebration from government officials and nobilities, and all people gather there.
sen.cmt: -用語集ではcelebrationの綴りが誤っていましたので訂正しました。
sen.e: In the palace of magnificent splendor, the emperor receives celebration from government officials and nobilities, and all people gather there.
In the palace of magnificent splendor, the emperor receives celebration from government officials and nobilities, and all people gather there.

sen.j: 拝賀が終わると、鶴と亀が舞い、皇帝の長寿を寿ぐ。
sen.e: After celebration, the crane and the turtle dance to celebrate long life of the emperor.
After celebration, the crane and the tortoise dance to celebrate longevity of the emperor.
sen.cmt: turtle を tortoise に修正しました。long life を longevity に修正しました。
sen.e: After celebration, the crane and the tortoise dance to celebrate longevity of the emperor.

sen.j: それに気を良くした皇帝は舞楽を奏させて自ら舞い、長生殿に戻っていく。
sen.e: The emperor feels good about it and has people play bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing) and dances by himself, then returns to Choseiden.

The emperor feels good about it and has people play bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing) and dances by himself, then returns to Chosei-den Hall (the Hall of Everlasting Life).
sen.cmt: Choseiden を Chosei-den Hall (the Hall of Everlasting Life) に修正しました。
sen.e: The emperor feels good about it and has people play bugaku (traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing) and dances by himself, then returns to Chosei-den Hall (the Hall of Everlasting Life).

sen.j: 祝言によく使われるのは「庭の砂ハ金銀の。
sen.e: For the words of congratulations, "Sands of the Garden are Gold and Silver".
The popular part for celebration quotes is; 'The sand of the garden is covered with gold and silver.
The popular part for celebration quotes is; 'The sand of the garden is covered with gold and silver.
Sands of the garden are gold and silver.
The sand of the garden is covered with gold and silver.
The sand of the garden is covered with gold and silver.
Balls are paved excellently.
It is filled with gems.
It is filled with gems.

sen.j: 五百重の錦や瑠璃の枢。
sen.e: Hundreds of nishiki (brocade) and lapis lazuli bearing.
Hundreds of thousands of brocades and doors made of lapis lazuli.
Hundreds of thousands of brocades and doors made of lapis lazuli.

sen.j: シャコの行桁瑪瑙乃橋。
sen.e: Squilla cross beam and agate bridge.
Beams are made of shining white seashells, and bridges are made of agate.
Beams are made of shining white seashells, and bridges are made of agate.
Crane and turtle on the shore of pond.
There are a crane and tortoise on the shore of the pond.
There are a crane and tortoise on the shore of the pond.
Mount Horai stays here.
The view of the palace is as exquisite as the one of Mt. Horai.
The view of the palace is as exquisite as the one of Mt. Horai.
Your blessing is thankful.
The grace of the Emperor is so precious.
The grace of the Emperor is so precious.
Your blessing is thankful.
The grace of the Emperor is so precious.'
The grace of the Emperor is so precious.'

sen.j: シテ それ青陽乃春になれば。
sen.e: Shite: When spring comes with green and sunshine.
Shite: Welcoming the advent of Chinese New Year,
Shite: Welcoming the advent of Chinese New Year,
We start the year with seasonal sechi-e.
New Year's rituals are the first celebration of the four seasons.
New Year's rituals are the first celebration of the four seasons.

sen.j: ワキ 不老門にて日月乃。
sen.e: Waki: At the Fromon Gate are the sun and the moon.
Waki: At the Furo-mon Gate (Gate of Eternal Youth).
Waki: At the Furo-mon Gate (Gate of Eternal Youth).
The emperor looks at the light.
The Emperor looks at the shining sun and moon.
The Emperor looks at the shining sun and moon.

sen.j: シテ 百官卿相に至るまで。
sen.e: Shite: All the ministers and nobilities
Shite: Many officials, ministers, and aristocrats crowded around.
Shite: Many officials, ministers, and aristocrats crowded around.

sen.j: 袖をつらね踵をついで
sen.e: Come all together
Touching their heels and sleeves each other.
Touching their heels and sleeves each other.

sen.j: ワキ 其数一億百餘人
sen.e: Waki: The number is more than a hundred millions and a hundred.
Waki: The number of the gathering crowds easily exceeds over 100 million.
Waki: The number of the gathering crowds easily exceeds over 100 million.

sen.j: シテ 拝をすゝむる万戸の声
sen.e: Shite: Thousands of voices of celebration.
Shite: In houses of commoners, people exclaim their adoration for the Emperor
Shite: In houses of commoners, people exclaim their adoration for the Emperor

sen.j: ワキ 貴一同に礼する其音は
sen.e: Waki: The voice of celebration
Waki: Since all raise their voices in their worship of the Emperor at once, their voices
Waki: Since all raise their voices in their worship of the Emperor at once, their voices

sen.j: シテ 天に響きて夥し
sen.e: Shite: Roars to the heaven.
Shite: Are echoing even in Heaven and reverberating powerfully.
Shite: Are echoing even in Heaven and reverberating powerfully.

sen.j: 地 庭の砂ハ金銀の。
sen.e: Jiutai (Noh chorus): Sands of the garden are gold and silver.
Jiutai (Noh chorus): The sand of the garden is covered with gold and silver.

sen.j: ワキ いかに奏聞申し候。
sen.e: Waki: Let me say a word to the emperor.
Waki: It is my honor to be allowed to make a proposal to Your Majesty.
Waki: It is my honor to be allowed to make a proposal to Your Majesty.
As it has been done every year.
Following the custom of every year.
Following the custom of every year.
The emperor dances with the crane and the turtle.
It would be wonderful if you order the Crane and Tortoise to dance.
It would be wonderful if you order the Crane and Tortoise to dance.

sen.j: 其後月宮殿にて舞楽を奏せられうずるにて候
sen.e: Afterwards he plays bugaku in the Moon Palace.
And host a party of dance and music at Gekkyu-den Palace (the Moon Palace) afterwards.
And host a party of dance and music at Gekkyu-den Palace (the Moon Palace) afterwards.

sen.j: 地 亀ハ万年の齢を経て。
sen.e: Jiutai: Turtle ages for tens of thousands of years.
Jiutai: A tortoise lives ten thousand years.
Jiutai: A tortoise lives ten thousand years.
Crane also ages for thousands of years.
And a crane lives one thousand years.
And a crane lives one thousand years.
May emperor age for years too.
As well.
As well.

sen.j: 地 千代のためしの数々に。
sen.e: Jiutai: In many occasions in the past.
Jiutai: There are many examples of auspicious things which enjoyed ever-lasting prosperity.
Jiutai: There are many examples of auspicious things which enjoyed ever-lasting prosperity.
In many occasions in the past.
There are many examples of auspicious things which enjoyed ever-lasting prosperity.
There are many examples of auspicious things which enjoyed ever-lasting prosperity.
What we should lay under the small pine tree.
What is a good example: Hime-komatsu (a type of pine tree).
What is a good example: Hime-komatsu (a type of pine tree).
Turtle on the shore dances.
When green tortoise dances and performs.
When green tortoise dances and performs.
Crane gives to the emperor.
A red-crowned Crane offer a one-thousand-year
A red-crowned Crane offer a one-thousand-year
A thousand years of life.
To the Emperor.
To the Emperor.

sen.j: 庭上に参向申しければ。
sen.e: They come to the garden to see the emperor.
If they come into the garden.
If they come into the garden.

sen.j: 帝も御感の餘りにや舞楽乃秘曲ハおもしろや
sen.e: The emperor dances gracefully to the bugaku.
The grateful Emperor therefore performs a secret dance amusingly.
The grateful Emperor therefore performs a secret dance amusingly.

sen.j: 地 月宮殿の白衣の袂。
sen.e: Jiutai: Sleeves of the white robe in the Moon Palace.
Jiutai: White sleeves (of the celestial people) in the Moon Palace.
Jiutai: White sleeves (of the celestial people) in the Moon Palace.

sen.j: 月宮殿の白衣の袂の色々妙なる花の袖。
sen.e: Colors of the sleeves of the white robe in the Moon Palace, Sleeves of beautiful flowers.
White sleeves (of the celestial people) in the Moon Palace change like sleeves of lovely flowers.
White sleeves (of the celestial people) in the Moon Palace change like sleeves of lovely flowers.

sen.j: 秋ハ時雨の紅葉の葉袖。
sen.e: In autumn the sleeves are leaves of red maple in the shower.
In autumn, they change like crimson foliage moistened in drizzling rain.
In autumn, they change like crimson foliage moistened in drizzling rain.

sen.j: 冬ハ冴えゆく雪の袂を。
sen.e: In winter the sleeves are of clear snow white.
In winter, they swirl like brisk snowflakes.
In winter, they swirl like brisk snowflakes.

sen.j: ひるがへす衣も薄紫の。
sen.e: Fluttering robe is light purple.
The robe of swirling sleeves is pale purple.
The robe of swirling sleeves is pale purple.

sen.j: 雲の上人゛の舞楽の声々゛に霓裳羽衣乃曲をなせば。
sen.e: Dances Geishouinokyoku to the voices of Saints of the cloud.
When the aristocrats play the music of Geishoui (feathered dress with a rainbow skirt) together.
When the aristocrats play the music of Geishoui (feathered dress with a rainbow skirt) together.

sen.j: 山河草木國土ゆたかに千代萬代と。
sen.e: May mountains and rivers and plants of the land live for ever and ever.
The Emperor is delighted and blesses the mountains, rivers, trees, and grasses, everything in His land so they will enjoy richness and thousands of generations of prosperity.
The Emperor is delighted and blesses the mountains, rivers, trees, and grasses, everything in His land so they will enjoy richness and thousands of generations of prosperity.

sen.j: 悦び給へば官人駕輿丁御輿を早め。
sen.e: Government officials (lower or middle ranked) kayocho (palanquin carriers) speed up the palanquin as the emperor rejoice.
Then the palace officials and the bearers of their palanquin increase the pace of its progress.
Then the palace officials and the bearers of their palanquin increase the pace of its progress.
May you live for ever and ever.
To Chosei-den Hall, whose name means the longevity of His Majesty.
To Chosei-den Hall, whose name means the longevity of His Majesty.
May you live for ever and ever.
To Chosei-den Hall, whose name means the longevity of His Majesty.
To Chosei-den Hall, whose name means the longevity of His Majesty.
It is happy.
His Imperial Majesty returns to Chosei-den Hall.
His Imperial Majesty returns to Chosei-den Hall.
That the emperor returns.
How auspicious it is.
How auspicious it is.
